page.title: 06ROE END FARM(PART 1)
page.content:
Roe End Farm is a very old family farm The total acreage is 808 on which several different crops are grown.There are 5 workers on the farm including the family.Mr.Rowe gets up at about 6 o'clock,he has been working on the farm since 1946.
There is a slope coming from the farm towards Beechwood,but it is flatter at the back.The soils are:-
Batcombe:fertile but easy to cultivate,also poorly drained. Winchester:very fertile but heavy and difficult to cultivate. Charity:poor,easily managed and gravelly.Well drained. Icknield:on the south facing slopes and almost pure chalk. Rabbits & pidgeons are pests on the farm.
